conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C, and D, and the task is to predict which container (E, F, or G) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
The image shows four spouts labeled A, B, C, and D at the top, with liquid flowing down. There are baffles in various orientations, and three containers labeled E, F, and G at the bottom.
Spout A is light blue, Spout B is yellow, Spout C is purple, and Spout D is orange. Container E is red, Container F is gray, and Container G is orange.
The baffles are angled in different directions: green, gray, purple, pink, and black baffles are visible.
The liquid from Spout A flows down and hits a horizontal barrier, then moves toward the left container (E).
The liquid from Spout B flows down and hits a horizontal barrier, then moves toward the center container (F).
The liquid from Spout C flows down and directly into the container on the right (G).
The liquid from Spout D flows down and hits a horizontal barrier, then moves toward the right container (G).
Container E receives liquid from Spout A.
Container F receives liquid from Spout B.
Container G receives liquid from Spouts C and D.
The liquid from spouts A, B, C, and D will flow into containers E, F, and G respectively, with G receiving liquid from both C and D.
